title: @Riot, now that you are going to release an arcade skin for Ezreal with all new VFX...
body: can you finally update Pulsefire Ezreal, you know to those who paid top dollar for an Ultimate skin? I'll be completely honest, seeing an arcade skin that is, personally, much better than an Ultimate Skin kills me and actually stops me from buying future skins because of how ripped off I feel.

replies.body:
Ezreal already has a ton of skins in comparison to others, why in gods name should they throw a VU just because they're coming up with different themed skins?

Also side note - they don't generally just update a random skin out of nowhere. If they ever do a VU on Ezreal himself, you can expect a VU for the rest of his skins.

Finally, they don't care if you feel ripped off you special little snowflake because the majority of people will still spend money on their product. Besides, Pulsefire Ezreal is still pretty badass IMO.

Pulsefire Ezreal is a 1820 RP Skin with a 3250 RP price tag. 

It's got a sci-fi theme, but it feels overshadowed by the Project line at this point. The particles are different from base, but only slightly. You've got a white ultimate instead of a yellow one. Compare that with Project Ashe, where every particle looks completely retouched.

Ezreal himself needs a visual update as well, and has needed one for a few years now (his walk cycle belongs in a museum), but Iron Stylus specifically stated that Ezreal is being held back because of Pulsefire Ezreal. The skin is old enough and jerry-rigged enough that changes to Base Ezreal's model or animations will almost certainly break it. His kit is mostly fine (you could argue the W needs a new direction), so he's not likely to get a VGU anytime soon, which makes it seem like he's going to be ignored for a few more years because of an overpriced skin...

Your argument makes sense, but it has to be wrong because his ult is blue and now white.

Although in all seriousness I agree some skins seem a bit lackluster when compared to other skins of comparable price.  So far I've found that Project EZ needs a rework, along with Gatekeeper Galio.

No one ever says anything about it because who plays galio anymore, but its an 1820 with only differend voice lines and a slight retecture on his spells.  They didn't even bother giving him new taunts, just new voices over the old animations.
I disagree about gatekeeper galio I love it and think for the most part is fine, I remember when they tried to change him to fire and it was so bad.
I just feel like for what they give you its more of a 1350 skin.  They could at least give him some new animations on his joke and taunt.  Thats my main complaint with it.

>(his walk cycle belongs in a museum)

I lol'd harder than I should have at this :p

I doubt it's the skin that holds him back.
Riot has said that they are committed to doing full VGUs first and then everything else.
Pulsefire sucks in comparison to this new skin.
Pulsefire sucks in comparison to most of his skins

I bought my Xbox 360 for $350 about 7 years ago. It was a great console at the time and I got a lot of fun and amusement out of it over the years. They announced the Xbox One a few years back that made many upgrades on the old console. I called up Microsoft and told them that since the Xbox One has all these improvements it's their obligation to upgrade the Xbox 360 so that it's just as good as the new console because I paid almost as much for it years before. They laughed at me and told me that that's not how businesses work.

Now replace the 360 with Pulsefire and the One with Arcade and hopefully you'll see why it's not going to happen.

Your analogy falls a bit flat as in the case of Xboxes, microsoft doesn't charge full price for an older console when a new one is released.  I could buy a 360 right now for about $60-70 (at first glance) and an Xbox one costs a couple hundred dollars at least.  That said, when pulsefire ezreal came out I looked at the skin, looked at the price, and thought that it was worth the cost.  If riot releases better skins or cheaper skins or whatever, I'm not entitled to any sort of compensation or an update on the product because I paid for it at the price it was 4 years ago.  Doesn't make it not annoying to see cheaper, better lookings skins come out though and if riot wanted to do a visual update on ezreal or his skins I'd be all for it.

The difference is this is a videogame, when someone looks at a 30 dollar purchase that looks like shit. Why would they ever buy it? It's the same with all the old champs, Riot wants their game to look decent so why do they leave all the stuff that looks like shit? Simple...riot doesn't care

It's not that they don't care it's that they don't profit off of it. Upgrading that skin to the standards set by new Ultimate skins would take the same amount of time as making a _new_ Ultimate skin. It would have to be completely redone from the ground up to fulfill those standards and that's just not something that's going to happen when they're not going to make a good enough profit off of it. They'd essentially be doing it for free since the vast majority asking for upgrades already own the skin.
True. Wasted 3250 RP on this garbage. Never Again Rito Never again.

They should just give everyone a refund and make that a 1350RP skin. Ultimate my ass. I'm pretty sure there are 1850 skins that are better than the ultimate skins (theres only 2, ezreal and udyr right?)

Look at Zombie brand (got him from a chest) he has a slighty different VO, different movement, spells, spell sounds, character model etc. 
For 1850. 
Now look at the nearly double priced PF Ez.
they have to do something at this point pfe is the fkn laughing stock of riot skins.
And dj sona i believe

There aint gonna be much particle effect in the arcade skin. The higher the price on RP on skins means there is more effort put into it. so if it ends up like 1350RP then there is somewhat of effort put into it but not much to change the particle effect like pulse fire ezreal.

Yo, we already know what Arcade Ez looks like, and yeah, it's got all new particles and audio effects. That's what the 1350 price entails, yo. Pulsefire is the oldest ultimate, and like many old skins, it's not very good. The overall quality of skins has risen over the years, to such a degree that the old skins have dropped in price do to their comparatively low quality.

HISTORY LESSON: 

Basically everyone here is on board the Pulsefire is a sucky over priced skin train. But this shows they don't know it's history. Pulsefire was the first ultimate skin, it was the first skin to have cool fancy things like lots of different colors and sounds and all that wonderful jazz that now days is built into almost every new skin. 

You think pusefire is shit now but when it came out it was THE SHIT. By far the best skin in the game, and well earned it's price. Times have changed, and I would agree the cost might need to go down, but there is more to this story than just what it is today.

Yes I know it's the first ultimate skin, but as of THIS moment, it isn't worthy of an ultimate skin, maybe a few years back (even a year ago) it would still serve as a good ultimate skin, but now that the quality for skins and expectations of skins (especially ultimate skins) have gone so high, it's about time it gets an update. Does that mean it's top priority? No it doesn't, but I expect it in the NEAR future.

At the time it came out Pulsefire was extremely good, you can't just complain that a product you bought some years ago (unless you bought it recently which is no one's fault but your own given how much skins have improved since then) isn't the same quality as the stuff you can buy now for less.  Would you complain to a car dealership that the car you bought 5 years ago had less stuff included than a car they're selling now for less money and demand they improve the car you bought before? No, because that's stupid.

As someone who also owns pulsefire ez.... we knew what we were getting into when we bought it. It happens.

Personally, id prefer seeing firefighter trist or magnificent TF get an update over pulsefire ez.

The skin is freaking 4 years old... if you bought it back then, there is no reason to feel ripped off because they improved their quality over the time.

As far as I know riot, they won't just "randomly" upgrade PFE. Either Ezreal would get a visual update, which is unlikely in the near future, and they'd bring it up to par, or they'll drop PFE's price like they did with outdated legendaries and give partial refunds (iirc). Though these refunds would be larger and I don't know how willing they are on that.

They dont really lose anything doing "refunds". You get RP back, which is essentially fun bucks, monopoly money, etc. You get to purchase 1 other skin/champ/whatever, but you dont inherently get your money back. Keeps the customers happy, which means its likely theyll pay more in the future.
I mean that must suck I feel bad for those people who bought pf ez..but im just mad they keep making arcade heroes but still only have 1 villain
Hey, ultimate shards disenchant for quite a bit, so its not all bad getting it twice.
more than the VFX I think it needs a texture update

I think it's because of how old it is. When it was first released, it was worth the price value that it had; however as time went by they gradually got better and better at making the skins, leading to cheaper, more detailed skins that have much more work put into them in the same time.

Pulsefire is just outdated, yes, but updating pulsefire will still be one hell of a project, especially with these standards (you're saying an arcade skin is better looking, is this subjective, or is it *actually* better looking?)

I think it would not fall under their top priorities list, but keep mentioning it and hopefully it gets worked on soon.
All I want is for them to fix pfe auto animation. It's awkward
Its sad that this gets upvotes, you can tell its all new players.

as a proud owner of Pulsefire Ezreal since release, I can add in my two cents by saying this new skin doesn't come in comparison. It is a little under the quality of Spirit Guard, but at least it isn't DJ sona which is basically a rip off. Ultimates transform as you level (something Arcade Ez doesnt do btw) and Sona's doesn't. She has glorified pallete swaps that play pretty cool music that could just as easily played on Windows Media Player or Itunes. 

Pulsefire also has a voice over and captivates me much more then any skin in this game has. I used to main him in S2 and 3, but have since stopped because I've found enjoyment in other playstyles (mostly Ryze) but rest assured, they've yet to top this skin for ezreal with others, let alone a glorified cloud costume.

Agreed with almost everything, but DJ Sona can let you and the 4 other players listen to the same song, its not the same as having it playing on a media player in the computer! I think its a pretty cool feature that makes the bucks worth too! From all the 3, spirit guard udyr is the worst case in my opinion, cause it looks like the champion should really look without having to pay for it! Udyr model is really ugly.
